author: tylercase
title: Cardano Caravan for Advisors
description: カルダノのブランド認知度を高めるには、物理的な世界とデジタルな世界のすべての関係者に対するマーケティングと教育が必要です。

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is in the miscellaneous category so this seems appr, the team has been active in the catalyst process and they present a unique plan to market the community advisor role.
f6_assessments.q1: The team behind this proposal are well known good faith actors in the Catalyst space. The plan presented is not detailed enough to conclude proposal success.
f6_assessments.q2: The combination of the team behind the proposal, plan to market catalyst/CA role and the community led aspect of this proposal the info needed to audit progress is sufficient.

f6_assessments.q0:
As the challenge is Miscellaneous, anything could conceivably meet it. However there is little detail in this proposal in terms of the impact is will have in Catalyst. What are the current information sources that already exist and how does this proposal improve on them. How are you going to reach out to the CA's and voters to get the to watch the shows?
Whilst I have yet to go through all the proposals from QUASAR in this fund, I did so In fund6 and they were all of a similarly vague format.
The shows are supposed to start on Dec 10 however I am now reviewing this proposal on Dec 10, and CA reviews don't' stop until the 16th. Funds won't be disbursed to successful projects until after this project is supposed to be already completed.
f6_assessments.q1: I reviewed all the ideas by QUASAR in fund 6, and read all the other reviewers comments on their proposals in the voting stage. The proposals were all relatively vague, with difference expertise stated for each one with no evidence to back them up. They were rated poorly by all reviewers. I have little confidence this proposer will successfully deliver on this proposal given this history and the limited details provided in this proposal. As stated above, the proposal is to start delivering shows on Dec 10, but this is during the CA review process. Thus the proposer obviously doesn't have a clear plan to deliver aligned with the cycles of the Catalyst challenge,
f6_assessments.q2: Whilst the proposal in relatively simple, 4 twitter shows at $500 ea starting on Dec 10. Impact of a proposal is more than just technical delivery. Please also provide some clear metrics with attached goals so that success can be measured.

f6_assessments.q0:
Since the challenge is miscellaneous challenge, it's hard to assess if the proposal addresses the challenge or not.
However, I think the idea of a Cardano Caravan could be something impactful if it's well thought and designed, because it'll help to raise awareness about Cardano's ecosystem throughout many locations that may never heard about Cardano or cryptocurrencies before, and they'll not get reach out through social media or digital marketing strategies. "La Bitcoineta" It's a really good example of the potential impact a Cardano-related caravan might have for its ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1:
Team member experience and expertise it's not well detailed into the proposal (2 proposers, only 1 profile briefly described, without including his/her background), so it's not completely clear how they'll be the right fit to develop this project.
Secondly, the detailed plan is vague. The solution statement is to create a Cardano caravan, while the detailed plan only described and ask founds for carrying out Twitter spaces to start discussing the idea and discuss also about Community Advisor role. I don't find the correlation between a caravan of Cadano for raising awareness about the ecosystem, and why It'd be important to discuss CA role for that matter in those twitter spaces, when there's other resources and tools for training CAs (like Catalyst School, community Catalyst webpage, guidelines, etc). Instead, in case of winning, I'd advise to use those twitter spaces to discuss about best practicing methods for carrying out the project, such as the routes and cities It'll visit, people who will embark upon the journey, which content will be prioritized to explain the overall Cardano ecosystem, etc.
I think the proposal should be better thought out by the team before coming to Catalyst, and I don't see the need for financing Twitter spaces for that matter. I think it'd be a waste of treasury's resources, since they didn't explain practically anything about the Cardano caravan idea, only asking funds for start thinking about it.
f6_assessments.q2:
Budget breakdown it's not well designed and explained at all. They ask for 2000 USD, and they say 500 per week. So basically they're asking 250 USD for running each "show" (Twitter space) to speak about CA role and voter role in Catalyst (nothing related to the solution statement about developing a Cardano caravan). 500 USD It seems quite high in my opinion for simply doing a Twitter space of a couple hours per week for simply discuss an idea. There's a lot of twitter spaces that are runned for free by Cardano community members. And also, they don't state any rationality about why they ask these amount and why it'd be reasonable that amount (so it seem a random number in my opinion).
Also, there's no KPI's or metrics for success presented, so we don't know how success/failure after this Twitter spaces will look like.
Recording the twitter space sessions doesn't seem enough for bring auditability to me.
As an advice, some KPI's that come to my mind could be:
- Numbers of assistants that join our Twitter spaces.
- New CAs and voters onboarded (I don't see how this would help the idea of the Cardano Caravan, but since in the proposal that's the HOW they've described, it'll be good to measure if there's newcomers in those roles).
- Number of interested members in running the Cardano caravan. And number of cities on where we have Cardano caravan enthusiasts.
- Number of possible cities/countries the Cardano caravan will attend to.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal of 'Cardano Caravan for Advisors' is a hands-on approach that is likely to integrate online and offline community interaction, increase awareness for Cardano and be a tool for community engagement. This proposal could be improved by being more specific about the actual problem (and thereby solution) it addresses - is this about the marketing/communication of Cardano as is? Or about reaching new people? How exactly does Twitter intertwine with the roadshow? How is quality of communications ensured?
f6_assessments.q1: Although this proposal lacks some specifics when it comes to the execution of the proposal, the given experience and enthusiasm for a hands-on approach are convincing. That, in combination with the relatively little requested funding, would make it a great pilot project, if a de-brief and assessment after the tour are included.
f6_assessments.q2:
Given the relatively little requested funding, the information provided is in relation to the proposal. 
This proposal will likely benefit more from the enthusiasm and hands-on approach of the proposer, rather than a detailed plan regarding the offline elements (e.g., the route). Quality assurance needs to be given though, and perhaps worked out in collaboration with other parts of the organisation.

f6_assessments.q0:
"The idea is excellent and would certainly help to create a new business model in events ticketing, solving a major problem nowadays in reselling tickets (it would make this process much more reliable), aligned with the challenge of the campaign. The problem is well described and solution is clear and valid. The "why" (motivaton) and "how" (plan) are good but could be improved as explained below.

Regarding the proposal itself, it says that it will start in art exhibitions in Berlin. It's great to start small but why this? was it random or was there analysis beforehand? the reason for it should be stated in the proposal. 
It would also be nice to see here if theres already some event interested in holding this trial/pilot. This previous engagement or at least interest validation (as in a letter of interest) could have have been done before also, to give more credibility to it. Moreover, there already some companies that offer this kind of service (https://www.google.com/amp/s/www.theverge.com/platform/amp/2021/9/11/22666642/dreamverse-beeple-nft-inaugural-display-at-metapurse-party) What would be the differentiation here?
 (-0,5 star score)

The motivation is very well described in qualitative a way but it would be nice to see some economics here. will this make the tickets more expensive? if so, how much? is there potential for them to save in other ways, using NFT instead of tradional way? if so, how much? This analysis would help to convice event organizers to see if the cost-benefit pays off.  (-0,5 star score)
In the same sense, it should be more clear what approach and communication strategy will be used to engage with event organizers (-1 star score). NFT would need to be de-mistified and explained, in a proper educational campaign and this is a great challenge for this project 

As further suggestions, a future scope increase in the project, putting in place in the same platform a place for NFT ticket re-seling, where buyers can sell their tickets to others and the payment and tickets are exchaged at the same time and validated by the system (with possible a transaction fee, to make it economical viable) would be great and add much value to this initiatve! Also, incoporating artistic works to the ticket could also increase its appeal"
f6_assessments.q1:
The alleged expererience is a good start but it could have more details on it. What NFT project in Cardano did you start and was it successful? Also, some way to verify this could have been provided like a likedin or site reference, a link to the project that is mentioned here, something like this. 
In addition, having someone that has contact and good relationship with event organizers in the team would help a lot, just as someone with marketing/events experience. (-1 star score)

As for the plan, it is sound but could have more details between creating smart contracts and creating test events. I see an intermediate step in engaging with event organizers, which wont necessairly be easy. (-1 star score)


Budget breakdown is fair but could be spread in the phases also to give more clarity on it. It would also be nice to see total hours it is expected to spend on each phase and total project
f6_assessments.q2: Milestones and deliverables (reports) are clear and well distribuited in time. Maybe a final report after project is fully executed to consolidate all conclusions and check how each fund data analysis compare to each would also be great (maybe na extra conclusion regardng evolution could be drawn out here). Also,  a post audit could be done after some fund rounds after fund 7. With all this data analysis in hand, how voters, proposers and CAs improved their respective activitiy in fund7 onwards? it could be qualitive, with feedbacks, or quantitative, with a more extensive data analaysis (comparing before and after) and what are the lessons learned
